text:
Cherise, I took a look at your LinkedIn profile. You have extremely relevant experience for a content marketer. One thing that stands out to me immediately is that you're talking about largely about inputs "pitch" "assist" "curate" "tasked with" vs outputs "added X followers" "published X articles that generated X views". If this is a pattern that is following through to your interviews then the impact is likely that interviewers feel confident that you can do the work (evidence: freelance offers) but less confidence that you can drive results for the business (evidence: no job offers).

It might be worth your time to engage a resume writer or coach who can help you think about how to position yourself and your work. The fact that you're getting interviews means you have a compelling resume and story. You're really close! Might just need to sharpen how you sell your story.

user_profile.real_name: Janessa Lantz, VP of Marketing at dbt Labs
user_profile.name: janessalantz

Cherise, I took a look at your LinkedIn profile. You have extremely relevant experience for a content marketer. One thing that stands out to me immediately is that you're talking about largely about inputs "pitch" "assist" "curate" "tasked with" vs outputs "added X followers" "published X articles that generated X views". If this is a pattern that is following through to your interviews then the impact is likely that interviewers feel confident that you can do the work (evidence: freelance offers) but less confidence that you can drive results for the business (evidence: no job offers).

It might be worth your time to engage a resume writer or coach who can help you think about how to position yourself and your work. The fact that you're getting interviews means you have a compelling resume and story. You're really close! Might just need to sharpen how you sell your story.
